comment.author: 26033330@N00
comment._content: They both look very and genuinely happy. I really like this image. It's very Real.

comment.author: 45621760@N00
comment._content: I'm quite sure this is the house where they lived, and the house seen in the background of the photo: kartor.eniro.se/m/azUhU I found a "målarmästare Olof Nilsson" on that adress in Kulladal in the adress calendar of Malmö from 1935. :) The house was owned by a shoemaker Edvard Nilsson (maybe his brother?). It's not impossible that they lived two families in a small house like that, a house that today is considered too small for one family.

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
olga s: It's so interesting that you did this research and located the Nilssons' house in Kulladal. It seems likely that the photo was taken in their own garden. Thank you for contributing to the information on the photo in this way! 
/Anna B.

comment.author: 85031122@N05
comment._content: I live in the house beside this.. Ludvigsgatan 3. It is a double house... It is very interesting to see this. We inherited an old Photo of the house from the front with the families children on it.. Would you be interested in a copy of that?

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
Thygesen79: How very nice to hear from a neighbour living in the same house! 

The original photo that you possess would not be appropriate to the context of the Einar Erici collection, I'm afraid, but I would certainly love to see a copy of it! Why don't you scan it and upload it to your Flickr account to show us here in a comment? (Better ask permission from the people in the photo first.)
/Anna B.
